metadata.title: CVE-2021-47342 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ext4:fix possible UAF when remounting r/o a mmp-protected file system Aftercommit 618f003199c6 ("ext4: fix memory leak in ext4_fill_super"), after thefile system is remounted read-only, there is a race where the kmmpd threadcan exit, causing sbi->s_mmp_tsk to point at freed memory, which the callto ext4_stop_mmpd() can trip over. Fix this by only allowing kmmpd() toexit when it is stopped via ext4_stop_mmpd(). Bug-Report-Link:<20210629143603.2166962-1-yebin10@huawei.com>

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
